catalog.college: College of Science, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics (CSTEM)

source.notes: Official course data comes from the EWU catalog. Use the search deep link as the canonical per-course URL. Avoid relying on in-page anchors, which are not stable.

courses.title: COMPUTING ETHICS
courses.notes: Satisfies a BACR for humanities and arts.
courses.description_summary: Computing in society: ethical frameworks, impacts on individuals, organizations, and culture.

courses.title: PROGRAMMING PRINCIPLES I
courses.notes: Concurrent registration in MATH 141 or higher highly recommended; prior programming may satisfy CSCD 110.
courses.description_summary: Programming fundamentals: data types, control flow, methods, arrays, file I/O; project-based.

courses.title: PROGRAMMING PRINCIPLES II
courses.notes: Concurrent registration in MATH 142 or higher highly recommended.
courses.description_summary: Object-oriented programming: composition, recursion, abstraction, inheritance, interfaces, lists, exceptions.

courses.title: C AND UNIX PROGRAMMING
courses.description_summary: UNIX development tools and C programming: pointers, structs, arrays, system calls; projects required.

courses.title: ARCHITECTURE AND ORGANIZATION
courses.description_summary: Digital computer design: number systems, Boolean algebra, digital circuits, microprocessor ISA; includes assembly.

courses.title: EXPERIMENTAL COURSE
courses.description_summary: Variable topic offering for new or trial content.

courses.title: SPECIAL STUDIES
courses.prerequisites: Permission of instructor, department chair and college dean.
courses.description_summary: Topics vary based on student and faculty interest.
